exploration_config.non_repetition_check: Reviewed existing leaderboard entries focusing on different problem framing - emphasizing offline-first, simple client-side solutions over AI-heavy approaches

trends.name: Productivity App Fatigue
trends.description: Users abandoning complex productivity systems for simpler, offline-capable alternatives
trends.evidence: App Store reviews consistently cite 'too complicated' and 'overwhelming setup' as primary reasons for deletion

trends.name: Offline-First Movement
trends.description: Growing demand for apps that work without constant internet connectivity
trends.evidence: Chrome extension reviews and YouTube comments emphasize wanting tools that 'just work' without cloud dependencies

trends.name: Single-Purpose Tools
trends.description: Preference for focused apps over all-in-one solutions
trends.evidence: Gumroad/Etsy digital planner success suggests users prefer simple, specific tools over complex platforms

market_research.monetization_trends: Subscription fatigue is driving demand for simple, focused apps that provide clear value without feature bloat. Users willing to pay for tools that reduce mental overhead rather than add features.

app_ideas.name: ClearTasks
app_ideas.signal_source: App Store reviews: 'Todoist - Why does adding a task need 10 taps?' and 'Any.do - The UI is overwhelming, just want a simple list'
app_ideas.description: Minimalist task manager with zero configuration - just add tasks and mark them done
app_ideas.target_user: Overwhelmed users who abandoned complex task managers due to setup complexity
app_ideas.pain_point_evidence: Multiple 1-2 star reviews cite UI complexity and excessive tap requirements for basic task entry across major productivity apps
app_ideas.differentiation: No categories, no projects, no tags - pure simplicity with offline-first design
app_ideas.subscription_fit: Premium unlocks unlimited tasks (free limited to 20), custom themes, and cloud backup for device switching

app_ideas.name: HabitDots
app_ideas.signal_source: App Store: 'Habitica - I don't want RPG stuff, just track if I did it' and Chrome Extension reviews wanting simpler habit tracking
app_ideas.description: Visual habit tracker using simple dot grids - one dot per day, green for done, gray for missed
app_ideas.target_user: People who failed at complex habit trackers and want pure visual progress without gamification
app_ideas.pain_point_evidence: Habit tracking apps consistently get 1-2 star reviews for over-complexity, with users specifically requesting 'just mark if I did it or not'
app_ideas.differentiation: No streaks counting, no badges, no notifications - pure visual feedback using dot patterns
app_ideas.subscription_fit: Premium allows unlimited habits (free limited to 3), custom colors, and progress analytics

app_ideas.name: QuickNote
app_ideas.signal_source: YouTube comments: 'I just want to write things down, not build a graph' and Obsidian App Store reviews about learning curve complexity
app_ideas.description: Instant note capture that opens directly to a blank note - no organization, no folders, just write
app_ideas.target_user: Note-takers who abandoned apps like Obsidian/Roam due to complexity and want frictionless capture
app_ideas.pain_point_evidence: Note-taking app reviews consistently mention setup complexity and feature overwhelm preventing quick thought capture
app_ideas.differentiation: No folders, no linking, no markdown - pure capture with simple search to find notes later
app_ideas.subscription_fit: Premium unlocks unlimited notes (free limited to 50), simple formatting, and device sync

app_ideas.name: SimpleTimer
app_ideas.signal_source: Chrome Extension reviews: 'StayFocusd - Timer is too rigid, real life isn't predictable' and Forest app reviews about session interruption
app_ideas.description: Flexible focus timer that adapts to interruptions without penalty - pause, extend, or restart without guilt
app_ideas.target_user: Focus app users frustrated by rigid timers that don't accommodate real-world interruptions
app_ideas.pain_point_evidence: Focus apps get negative reviews for punishing users when life interrupts their sessions, creating stress instead of productivity
app_ideas.differentiation: No strict time blocks, no penalties for interruption, no productivity shaming - just gentle time awareness
app_ideas.subscription_fit: Premium adds custom time presets, session statistics, and background operation

app_ideas.name: CleanPlanner
app_ideas.signal_source: Gumroad/Etsy reviews: 'Wish there was an app version of this exact layout' and 'Digital planners in apps are never as clean as these PDFs'
app_ideas.description: Digital daily planner that replicates the visual simplicity of popular PDF planners in app form
app_ideas.target_user: PDF planner users who want the same clean layouts but with the convenience of a mobile app
app_ideas.pain_point_evidence: Strong demand for PDF planners shows users prefer simple layouts, but reviews cite sync and portability issues
core_loop: Fill in planned items and priorities
app_ideas.differentiation: Mimics popular PDF planner aesthetics exactly - clean typography and layouts without app-like complexity
app_ideas.subscription_fit: Premium unlocks different planner layouts, custom sections, and past day review

app_ideas.name: PersonalWiki
app_ideas.signal_source: Chrome Extension reviews wanting offline knowledge tools and YouTube comments about app dependency fatigue
app_ideas.description: Personal knowledge base that works completely offline - capture, organize, and find your own information
app_ideas.target_user: Knowledge workers tired of cloud-dependent note apps who want reliable offline access to their information
app_ideas.pain_point_evidence: Reviews consistently mention connectivity requirements as friction points, with users wanting offline-capable tools
app_ideas.differentiation: Completely offline operation with simple page linking - no cloud dependency or complex features
app_ideas.subscription_fit: Premium adds image support, backup export, and advanced search within content

app_ideas.name: EnergyLog
app_ideas.signal_source: YouTube comments about energy management and Reddit confirmation of daily energy pattern interest
app_ideas.description: Simple daily energy level tracking with pattern recognition - no complex health metrics, just energy in/out
app_ideas.target_user: People who want to understand their energy patterns without complex health tracking or biometric integration
app_ideas.pain_point_evidence: Users express interest in energy awareness but find health apps too complex and medical-focused
app_ideas.differentiation: Focus purely on subjective energy levels without health metrics, exercise tracking, or medical framing
app_ideas.subscription_fit: Premium adds custom energy categories, longer historical data, and pattern insights

app_ideas.name: ChoiceSimple
app_ideas.signal_source: Twitter replies about decision fatigue and YouTube comments about daily choice overload
app_ideas.description: Decision-making aid that presents pros/cons visually without complex algorithms - just clear thinking structure
app_ideas.target_user: Decision-fatigued individuals who want structured thinking tools without AI or complex analysis
app_ideas.pain_point_evidence: Users consistently mention decision fatigue but want simple tools, not AI-powered solutions that add complexity
core_loop: See visual summary to clarify thinking
app_ideas.differentiation: No AI recommendations, no complex scoring - just visual organization of thoughts with simple importance weighting
app_ideas.subscription_fit: Premium allows unlimited decisions (free limited to 5), decision history, and custom criteria categories

app_ideas.name: GentleBreaks
app_ideas.signal_source: Chrome Extension reviews wanting less aggressive break reminders and YouTube comments about notification fatigue
app_ideas.description: Subtle break reminders that suggest rather than demand - gentle notifications without productivity guilt
app_ideas.target_user: Screen workers who want break awareness but find existing apps too aggressive or shame-inducing
app_ideas.pain_point_evidence: Break reminder apps get negative reviews for being too forceful and creating anxiety rather than helping
core_loop: Choose to take break or dismiss
No tracking or guilt for skipping
app_ideas.differentiation: Suggestion-based rather than mandatory - no productivity tracking or shaming for dismissed breaks
app_ideas.subscription_fit: Premium adds custom break activities, different notification styles, and optional gentle motivation

app_ideas.name: MoodDots
app_ideas.signal_source: App Store reviews wanting simpler mood tracking and YouTube comments about mental health app complexity
app_ideas.description: One-tap daily mood tracking using color dots - see patterns over time without complex mood analysis
app_ideas.target_user: People interested in mood awareness who find dedicated mental health apps too clinical or complex
app_ideas.pain_point_evidence: Mood tracking apps often criticized for being too detailed or medical, when users want simple awareness tools
app_ideas.differentiation: Pure visual pattern recognition without analysis, therapy suggestions, or medical framing
app_ideas.subscription_fit: Premium adds mood notes, longer history, and simple pattern insights without medical interpretation
